current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To strengthen nutrition education for elementary school
		  and secondary school students to promote healthy eating choices through
		  developmentally appropriate lessons and activities integrated into the school
		  day.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and
			 Forestry

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
In this Act:

quote.#tail: have the meanings given the terms in

text.#text: The terms

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 9101 of
			 the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9101

header.#text:
Programs to
			 promote healthy eating and nutrition education

term.#text: programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education

text.#text: The term

means programs
			 that—

increase a
			 student's ability to recognize, choose, and consume healthy foods;
use—

nutritional
			 materials and methods that are scientifically sound and developmentally
			 appropriate; and

nutritional
			 materials that are supported by the most recent Dietary Guidelines for
			 Americans published under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 301 of the National Nutrition Monitoring and
			 Related Research Act of 1990
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Nutrition Monitoring and Related Research Act of 1990/s:301

text.#text:
includes
			 professional development programs for teachers, school staff, and food service
			 workers to allow them to teach healthy eating and nutrition effectively and to
			 promote a healthy school culture.

header.#text:
Programs to
			 promote healthy eating and nutrition education

text.#text:
Each local educational agency that receives assistance
			 under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, as a condition of receiving such
			 assistance—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:I/pt:A

text.#text:
develop and
			 implement programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education for all
			 schools served by the local educational agency, which may include—

the use and
			 distribution of educational materials, lessons, programs, and other activities
			 that emphasize—

a balanced
			 approach to a healthy diet and lifestyle;

the integration
			 of healthy eating with physical activity to maximize health; and

a
			 variety of healthy eating and wellness activities that improve student
			 knowledge and skills related to healthy eating and nutrition and do not
			 emphasize child weight or weight loss; and

periodically
			 monitor schools’ efforts in improving nutrition understanding and healthy
			 eating among students.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consult multiple
			 viewpoints in developing and implementing programs to promote healthy eating
			 and nutrition education, which may include—

text.#text:
A
			 local educational agency subject to

consulting with
			 families, students, school officials, and other interested community members in
			 order to develop programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition
			 education;

working with
			 organizations with nutrition education expertise, such as institutions of
			 higher education, hospitals, cooperative extension offices, State and local
			 health departments, the Society for Nutrition Education and Behavior, community
			 organizations, farm groups, and others, for guidance in developing the programs
			 to promote healthy eating and nutrition education and for assistance in
			 implementing and evaluating such programs;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and State agencies
			 delivering services under the nutrition education and obesity prevention grant
			 program established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Team Nutrition of the Food and
			 Nutrition Service of the Department of Agriculture

text.#text:
working with
			 applicable government authorities, including

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, for technical assistance in designing programs to promote
			 healthy eating and nutrition education for the schools;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 28 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008

text.#text:
working with
			 district and school wellness councils or other school health advisory groups in
			 developing, implementing, and evaluating programs to promote healthy eating and
			 nutrition education;

integrating
			 programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education with the local
			 school wellness policy required under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 9A of the Richard B. Russell
			 National School Lunch Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act/s:9A

text.#text:
providing
			 professional development that includes nutrition education to staff members of
			 the local educational agency.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a periodic
			 report regarding programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education in
			 the State that includes a summary of the nutrition education monitoring data
			 collected from each local educational agency under

text.#text:
Each State educational agency receiving assistance
			 under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:I/pt:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish an inter-agency task
			 force to review nutrition education curricula and recommend effective nutrition
			 education programs for elementary schools and secondary schools.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text:
such sums as may be necessary for each of fiscal years 2014
			 through 2019

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: There is authorized to be appropriated
